intro: Alchornea hirtella, commonly known as roughleaf alchornea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy or rough to the touch, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in greenish or yellowish inflorescences. Alchornea hirtella is known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
